Reviews.Title: “Good value, quiet and relaxing but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: vogensen
Reviews.Content: A good family hotel. My wife and I had a room on the 4th foor overlooking the pool and garden. My son and 2 grandsons had a room with kitchnette to be able to cook meals. Our room came equipped with a mini fridge and an LCD TV, dishes, cutlery and an electric kettle for tea or coffee. If you want a hairdryer just ask for it at the desk. Internet is available in the room for a fee but not worth it. System too slow and at times couldn't connect at all. Had to ask for money back for the last day. Present system will be soon be replaced by the more efficient Accor wi-fi system, I was told. Friendlly staff with reasonable English. Polite with helpful suggestions on using the bus or metro system and getting around Rome. To get from Ciampino airport to the hotel I used http://www.airportconnection.it/ and reserved their services online. Efficient, reliable and cheaper than the service provided by the hotel: 65 euros for 5 people and luggage. The hotel charges 75 euros. Down side: If you stay longer than 3 nights, rooms are not cleaned nor are towels changed, unless you ask for it and pay an extra fee. We had to take down the garbage to the cellar. They also ask you to recycle but bags are not provided. Location was also a problem. Even though the hotel was close various bus halts to visit Rome, it was far enough from the center to make coming back to it during the day for a rest quite impractical. That being said, I would recommend this hotel to families who want to cook some of their meals and save on food and also to those who do not have walking issues.

Reviews.Title: “Quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: tpilomia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Adagio for four nights and were quite happy with the establishment. The location is in a residential area on a quiet no exit street, almost a private lane. It is surrounded by trees and the hotel itself has extensive gardens. We took the normal room without cooking facilities, but even this had a small fridge, dishes, and cutlery. The floors are imitation wood with no carpets giving an appearance of cleanliness. The room was spacious and opened on to a good size balcony overlooking the garden and pool. The bathroom was modern with a good shower and plenty of hot water. The television had all the Italian channels and included CNN, Sky, BBC, and even a Spanish and Portuguese channel. There was no cleaning of the room, but this was not a problem for us. I actually preferred to have no stranger coming in the room, and felt safe leaving my passport behind during the day. I can't speak about the breakfast since we always had ours at a cafe on the Piazza Pio XI, but the restaurant in the hotel grounds serves very good food at reasonable prices. In the lobby of the hotel there is a snacks machine with cold drinks, crisps, and chocolates, all at almost supermarket prices. The only negative thing in our sojourn was the WI Fi, which even though paying 3 euros to use was practically worthless. We would often wait thirty minutes just for it to open, and this counted in our internet time. We complained but to no avail. Apparently it is an old problem, with everyone complaining, but the hotel still charging. At the reception desk everyone spoke reasonable English and was very helpful. As far as location is concerned, there is a five minute walk down the Via Leone Dehon, turning left onto Via Leone XIII, to the Piazza Pio XI, which is really only a giant intersection of the Via Gregorio VII and the Via Anastasio II. There you can find a very good cafe for your morning capucino and croissants (only one euro for a latte and .80 for a croissant), a pharmacy, several restaurants, a pastry shop called the Pasticceria Siciliana Svizzera, a bank, and most importantly a large supermarket where you can buy your salad or pasta to take back to the room. Most importantly, all the bus stops to take you either down Via Gregorio VII to the Vatican or down Via Anastasio II to the Valle Aurelia metro station can be found here. I recommend the daily pass costing 4 euros, which you only punch in on your first trip. You can buy either single tickets or the daily pass at a small Tabaccharia next to the supermarket, where the owner speaks excellent English. The area around the hotel is not interesting for walking, but I did walk to the nearby Villa Doria Pamphili Park, about ten minutes away from the hotel. Unfortunately, as can happen often in Rome, the sidewalk stops at a major highway, the Via Aurelia Antica, and you must risk your life to run through the fast moving cars and motorcyles. Somebody forget the zebra crossing. Oops! The park itself is enormous and looked like a beautiful area for a future visit. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you want a quiet street and don't mind taking buses to get to the major tourist sites. If you are able to book early and get a good price then it is an extra plus.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap and relaxing place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pilombeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sons the last week of March at the Adagio Dehon in an apartment. The room was nice with a kitchen. The receptionists were friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little out of the way but it's a short walk to Piazza Pio XII where you can catch a bus to wherever you want to go. What I liked was having the kitchen which allowed us to save a lot in terms of food. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is staying in Rome for a few days with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Adagio Roma Dehon........”
Reviews.Author: Rachael B
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, my friends & I had the best time at the hotel its only minuits away from the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Justine H
Reviews.Content: It was great to have some room!! Seperate bedroom for the children (bunk beds) Having the option to cook if you wanted, and having a fridge was great. If you are prepared to walk or work out buses it is definately the best option. We walked everywhere family, boys 10 & 11. Having access to a washing machine was also very good!! We costed accomodation right in the heart of Rome and it was twice the price. The hotel arranged for a driver to collect us from the airport at a set rate, which we found excellent, trying to work out trains or buses when you first arrive would be a nightmare. We found this accomodation excellent, it was great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Adagio Roma Dehon”
Reviews.Author: Jac-M Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Studio very good size with large balcony overlooking adjacent gardens. Kitchenvery well stocked and cooking utensils etc. clean . Although BBc world News available - would be a little extra if there was another English speaking channel available on the TV. staff very helpful and knowledgable. Easy to reach Rome centre. Be aware of parking car in road - we had ours broken into a items stolen!! Even though right next to CCTV camera!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and knowledgable staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were able to provide lots of useful information ranging from where to purchase food, how to get around and good sights. The room that we stayed in was quite good even though it clearly needed some maintenance attention to the bathroom and kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The matraces are too soft to provide good sleep. The covers are not made of natural materials which leads to all night sweatting. The smell from the bathroom showed that the canalization is not properly separated by the water traps. The drainage from the basin and from the shower was bad and water was staying without adequate drainage.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service at good location”
Reviews.Author: JuniperTree44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine nights. Room was big as was bathroom. The kitchen was adequate as a kitchenette. Location was really good and buses to the center were short rides and easy to catch. Now the bad. The main staff member, Laura was extremely unfriendly and rude rude rude. There was a huge disgusting stain above our bed and we had asked twice to get it cleaned and they didn't. During the 10 days room was cleaned once as we knew but there waa never enough toilet paper. When I phoned front desk for some, they refused to send it up and I hd to go to lobby to get it. The fridge had no ice tray and when we asked front desk for ice they sent us to hotel restaurant. They gave us ice with hesitation and said they won't give it again. When I had phoned for the cost and asked if there was Internet they said it's pay wifi but free wifi in lobby. This was a LIE. Lobby has one computer with Internet for use which was always being used. This is not what wifi is. The staff need to learn the definition of wifi. We finally caved in and bought Internet for our room but the connection was horrible and we were always cut out. What a scam and waste of our 13 euros. Will not recommend it. Won't ever stay again. You can find much better for what adagio charged. Sooo disappointed that Accor is willing to put their name on this awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamachado Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, staff is helpful and rooms are large and clean, as well as bathroom. Ask for an apartment including kitchen, so you can buy pasta in a supermarket near by and prepare your own Italian dish. The hotel is 10 minutes away from the center of the town, but you can easily take a 10 min bus to get there. Buying a day pass for buses and subway (3 euros) is the best choice, so you can go to anyywhere from Spain square. If you miss the last bus to go back (12am), you can go by taxi paying 15 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: farrell285
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel to the west of the City Centre in a quiet location. Good bus links around 5 minutes away to The Vatican and Rome City Centre. A gentle walk to The Vatican took us just over half an hour in 30C heat. Good air conditioning in the room and a well designed kitchen area in a cupboard but don't expect to cook anything more than simple food. We stayed 9 days and had one room clean during that time. This is inadequate but no complaints as this was known before we booked. There is the option to pay for the additional cleaning services that are frequently available elsewhere. Friendly staff in the hotel who were very helpful. Car driving can be difficult in Rome but once you learn the rules only the motor cyclists pose a continuing challenge by zooming in from any and all directions. However, the flexibility of visiting other locations that would be difficult to get to or take a long time in so doing makes hiring a car worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel in a quiet and green area. The 4-person room was clean and of a decent size, with full kitchen equipment hidden in a closet. Not easily accessible from the Fiumicino airport unless you take a taxi. If you wish to travel by train via Roma Travestere, you need to change twice. The hotel has a car shuttle service to Fiumicino for a fixed fee of EUR50 which we used on the way back - for a 4 person family the fee is equal to the public transport tickets. When you become comfortable with the Rome bus system it is easy to get to the most of the Rome attractions direct by a single bus (571) or via the nearby Valle Aurelia underground station (a few stops by bus 31 or 33). The reception personnel was nice and helpful. The breakfast was served in a beautiful garden surrounded by nicely smelling herbs (lots of rosemary plants), near the outdoor swimming pool. The hotel room had a paid WiFi service and a flat screen TV. The room was nicely airconditioned. A good value for money indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A garden oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tep88
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Adagio Rome Dehon. The multilingual front desk staff were efficient and very helpful in making reservations, etc. We enjoyed returning to the peaceful hotel for a swim in their pool after a busy day sighteseeing. The hotel is located less than 15 minutes by local bus from the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL ROME”
Reviews.Author: GABIPARASCHIV
Reviews.Content: I went in Rome in June this year for 6 days ,with my husband, my son and his girlfriend, and it was fine.The hotel was nice, clean, the staff helpful with free maps and tips for our daily program .I loved the pool, the clean water refreshing our afternoons. The Kitchenette was very helpful, we cooked pastes,salads eggs,even roast chicken ! We have seen almost all the "top 10" attractions (Colosseum, Forum, Villa Doria Pamphilj, the Spanish steps, a lot of the churches and parks, San Pietro Basilica, Vatican - the museum, and so on...) We walk all day long, and sometimes, a good part of nights ! The time was too short, but I threw 2 coins in FONTANA DI TREVI, and... I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good quality and price. The location was good, you have to take a bus to go to the center, but the station is not far. I recomand to use also the Metro Cipro or Valle Aurelia to get into the center. The hotel has a pool which is perfect in a summer hot days. Rooms are clean but for a stay of 7 day there is no cleaning service. At least once at 3 days might be helpfull.. expecialy that the turist are not prepare with garbege bags or bath cleaning materials. The kitchen was full equiped witch was the best point.

Reviews.Title: “Just a bed for the night!”
Reviews.Author: Scottshoot
Reviews.Content: Unhappy receptionist gave us a functional welcome. We were in an apartment room and had booked 3 beds. Corridors are gloomy and wallpaper is scuffed. Room 120 is dark, bathroom was smelly and furniture is dated and basic. Extra bed is a joke. No hair dryer, micro wave, oven,toaster, DVD player included. Noisy footsteps above woke us each morning. We tried to move but receptionist said they were full. We had pre-paid a week otherwise would have checked out. Pool area and the restaurant are very pleasant and feel like they are part of a different hotel. Location was fine for us although the 10min walk to the bus in the heat could be a hassle. Couple of reasonable super markets are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A modern and beautiful to stay in Rome, close to (but not in) the city center.”
Reviews.Author: fseidl
Reviews.Content: I've been in Rome some times and I've learned: you can't have everything. Close to the main attractions, the hotels are: old/small or good/expensive. Adagio has a good balance. I found a good rate for a spacious room with a nice view, the hotel is extremely beautiful, modern but still with an Italian personality and it's only 2 or 3 bus stops from the Vatican, where you can start your day (and from there, walk a bit, take a tour bus or the subway and explore the rest of the city. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “privacy, helpful staff, lovely pool & outdoor cafe”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we liked this hotel a LOT. the staff was incredibly helpful. it is so pretty and mostly well-maintained. our room did not have the kitchenette. it had plates, fridge, corkscrew. the balcony furniture was skimpy and there was mildew in the bathroom around the tub/shower that needed some old-fashioned scrubbing. this hotel is not in the city center, so taxis were an added expense. in rome, taxis are much more expensive than were were accustomed to paying. the grounds are lovely, lovely and inside the hotel there was no noise at all. many americans like several cups of coffee in the morning--please make it easily available with breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Adagio Rome Dehon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the map with the departure of the busses ,going to the top-tourist-attractions in Rome, that we got at the hotel reception. Thanks for the Adagio comfort , close to the city center and in a green environment. It' s unique.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ikap82
Reviews.Content: Given the generally low standard and high prices of accommodation in Rome, this hotel is a true gem! Located a bit further out of the centre but still only a short bus ride (or drive if you have a car) to the Vatican, the hotel is in an ideal location to explore the eternal city! Rooms are sizeable, clean and bright, and even have a large balcony! Beds are comfortable, and there is even a very nice swimming pool with a bar/restaurant next to it. The staff are very friendly, professional and helpful,showing you that it is a real pleasure for them to have you there. They make you feel that above all they want you to have a comfortable stay and that it's not just your money they're after! We were booked for two nights but our flight was cancelled and we arrived a day later, so had to cut down our stay (unfortunately, since this was a great hotel!) to one night. Still, the hotel staff showed understanding and didn't charge us for the first night as a matter of courtesy! We are certainly not finished with Rome and will definitely be back very soon! However, now we know exactly which hotel to go to, as this is definitely the best hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL BUT SCARY LOCATION AT NITE”
Reviews.Author: PACQUIO
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is great clean and spacious we stayed for one week but they don't come and clean the room every day. With kitchen utensils n fridge you can cook if you wish, supermarket is just around the corner. The staff are excellent and extremely helpful and friendly, But we had a bad and scary experienced the hotel is located in a quiet residential street while on our way to the hotel near the gasoline station going up the hill two an identified man in a dark blue car screaming from a distance asking if we are from other country as we walk they followed as and claiming them self to be Policemen, stated that their looking for drugs and asking if we had money they open my husband wallet insisted and and asking if we had money. Thanks GOD he just got $20.00.Since there's no money in his wallet the guy turn to me and said how about you, you have money repeatedly just about to open my pocketbook I prayed hard not to .... Instead he looks at me shakes my hand with his cold clammy hands and fled hurriedly. I know PADRE P I O is there to protect us for we just came from San Giovanni to celebrate PADRE P I O' S Feast Day. Thanks GOD our vacation almost end up a Nightmares. Location is good, but don't stay late on the street, when we reach the hotel we reported the incident, for all we know were not the only victims that evening.....beware with the bad people around.......

Reviews.Title: “peacefull and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: DERWYN Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A nice relaxing atmosphere away from the mayhem of central Rome, but to get into central rome can be a bit of a drag, the best way we found was to walk to the bus stop on Piazza Pio and get the 916 bus which goes to the Piazza Venezia, right by the Vittorio Emmanuelle monument, from there it is close enough to walk to the Colleseum, Forum, etc, you can obviously get off anywhere in between which is convenient for the Piazza Navona, Castel San Angelo and the Vatican, although you can walk to the Vatican in approx 25mins from hotel. We liked the feel of the hotel which was set out more like a residential apartment complex rather than a hotel. The balcony was large, private and had nice views over the rooftops of Rome, some rooms have views of St Peters dome, though ours was obscured by trees. The pool area was a great place to relax after a busy day in Rome. We didn't use the on site restaurant, so cannot comment, but it looked very nice, if a little expensive. The room was spacious and airy with large patio doors and small but functional kitchen area, which was a godsend. There is a convenient supermarket located on the Piazza Pio about 10mins walk. If in Rome for only 2 or 3 days it may be more convenient to stay in the center if Rome, but for longer stays (we stayed 6 days) it is nice to be able to get away from the hustle of central Rome and have a bit of relaxation, with a few home comforts, i.e kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant not part of hotel! they had a 1am disco the hotel had no control over agghh!”
Reviews.Author: RosG
Reviews.Content: Quite mixed the apartment was well equipted and we asked for a quiet room the disco at the restaurant Friday evening went on until 1am the hotel had no over the it as the restaurant and pool are a separate operation, therefore nothing was done about it, a very rude man from the hotel told us to call the police, great eh! Rather far out of Rome and good if you are okay paying 20 euros to go into Rome. Would stay further in the middle of Rome next time only went for the pool for the children!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, but not in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jensen09
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week's stay at Adagio Residence Rome. The aparthotel is placed in a residental area in the western Rome, within walking distance from St. Peter's Basilica. From the airport (Fiumicino) we took the "Leonardo Express", wich cost 11€. It stops on Termini, from where you can take Metro line A to the "Valle Aurelia" station. Tickets are sold in kiosk. From the exit of Valle Aurelia you go right and then using the stairs on left hand. On top of the stairs you will find a busstation and can use several busses. Take the bus to Piazza Pio, go to the Esso gazstation and continue this direction untill Q8 station. On right hand you will find Via Leone Dehon where the hotel is placed. We had trouble the first time with finding the hotel, but this guide is the easiest way to find the hotel from Termini. The hotel is NOT placed in the center of Rome, but in return it is very quiet placed on the top of a hill. It is placed in a big garden and the only neighbour is Cardinal Hotel St. Peter. The service is really great, but have in mind that it is appartments and not a hotel in that way. This means that there is no cleaning except at arrival and no change of linen. The reception is open 24/7 and will help with any question. There is also an internet corner wich can be used for free. The appartmens are really great. The kitchenette is fully equiped, but only with to hot plates and not much kitchen counter. But we cooked several times our selves, wich worked really great. The bathrooms are very big and newly renewed. The balconies are lovely, you can't see or hear the neighbours at all! The also have flowerboxes. The swimmingpool is also great, there is even a lifeguard! There is a restaurant overviewing the pool, wich is higly recommended! If you don't mind using the busses and the metros every day, we would really recommend the hotel! Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “off center but lovely”
Reviews.Author: arnonag
Reviews.Content: Booked via Apartment2Book web site. The site present the place as a private place turned into a Villa with apartments. I was surprised to see that this is part of a chain of apartment hotels (see web site URL at the bottom). In addition, free parking and Wi-Fi are cited in the site - not true. The hotel is off center close to Piazza Pio XI, some 15 min walk to Vatican, but 15min by scooter to the center of Rome and 30 min to Termini central station. It is located in a small street close to Pamphilli park which is a good area of Rome. Transportation from Piazza Pio XI is by bus (which we did not check hence I rented a scooter as we arrived). If you have a car check that your parking is included, otherwise you must park in the street which is also not so bad. The hotel itself is clean, have a couple of options for low and high cost apartments (If I remember correctly from 100 to 140 Euro per night). Apartment are large clean and have nice bathrooms and a small kitchenette and refrigerator stacked in a cupboard. The pool is nice but is too short for real swimming. still it is refreshing. The restaurant outside is a nice addition. we did not check their lunch or dinner but the breakfast that may come with you order (or pay 6 Euro) is not something I recommend. You are better off finding a small Italian bar for coffee and sandwich or make your own at the kitchenette. The stuff is cordial and helpful and tries to make your stay as smooth as possible. Even though our room was not what we expected they change it for a higher floor, double bed room and allow me to freely park my scooter in their indoor parking. Some warnings: 1. Try and order directly. 2. Choose the exact location of the room - preferably looking into the main garden at the second floor or higher (the lower apartments face the entrance or a dense shrubbery and might be dark) 3.Choose a room with double bed in advance. 4.Cleaning is automatic only for a stay of a week and above. If this is important to you, make the arrangement in advance. 5. have some transportation to the city ( I chose a scooter which is great if you are a motorcyclist and have no fear). The hotel is a bit far from the center of town. 6. Kitchenette has all the facilities but no basic elements for cooking (oil, sugar etc.) make sure to get them at the local store. 7. Wi-Fi is useless - work only in the public area for a cost. In all, a nice option for a relaxed a bit off center apartment hotel. The direct internet site: http://www.pv-holidays.com/scripts/fiche_produit.php?id_ofr=280&id_sai_passe=2 Telephone: [-]

Reviews.Title: “Ok.,but-----!”
Reviews.Author: RICHB351
Reviews.Content: The 2 of us stayed from Thurs.,May 8,to Mon.,May 19,2008,Room203,Monteverde Bldg.11 LONG DAYS!(Extended, 'timsesharing vacation)We are in our 50's,but very active.I don't want to put the 'place down',since there are mitigating circumstances,that got us 'agitated'.Of course, getting approx. only .54 cents,for a Euro,and, at one 'Exchange Booth',.49 cents.on a Euro,didn't make us happy! (Use an ATM,instead!) When we checked in,the A/C was broken.Front desk,says"5 days 'til repairman comes,(that's Monday!) No emergency A/C 'contract',even on 85 degree days! Patio doors, are 'sliders', w/NO screens,and No windows,in room! Had to stay in the room,w/fan blowing hot air out,for 5 days,can't leave 'sliding doors' open>>> Big Bugs, fly in! No king sized beds in Italy,front Desk says>>> Had 2 twins held together by a sheet,so we didn't fall through the 'crack'. TV>>,One English speaking channel'BBC', 24 hrs.of news,(just what I want,on vacation!)the rest of the many channels were Italian,French,etc.Oh,you can see 'The Dubai;,channel,from the Arab nations,and see where all your 'fuel money' is going,to build their new cities.That's fun! Bring your own clock/radio.,none there.They have 'wake up' service,if needed.No coffee maker,just a '2 cup', expresso maker.No computer on premises,you have to have your own 'laptop',and you can get 'the service', for free,there.Gonna take a 'laptop',to Italy?No ATM,on premises,either.We cooked a few meals in the room,the 2 burners are 'close',meaning>> to get the 'pan' and pot,on together,you had to do a 'balancing act' ,on the burners.That room,#203, had no 'bathroom counter space', you put everthing on the long bathoom sink, shelf,next to the faucet',The shower,had a 'stationary', glass door,get this> 1/3 the length, of the shower/tub,water splashes all over the floor,while showering.Good hot water,though! We either walked,and we walked about 40 miles,for the 11 days,we were there,or took a 'taxi',About the 'taxi',the front desk doesn't tell you this>> they call a taxi,and it comes in 5 min.s',but there is an extra charge of 7 and a 1/2 Euros, (approx. $10 US),for that pick/up.It's on the 'taxi meter'.The ''staff' was very good,incl.the maid service.Things improved,when Monday came,and the A/C,came on!(Oh, Happy Day!!)We only ate one meal there, breakfast, cold cuts,breads,coffee,cereals,juices,by the pool.About $20 US,each. (If you go to Rome/and this resort) Ok,here's my tips>>>>Nearby ,'food stores',(about 4 blocks, away)'Pam',small store,butcher + fresh bread, in rear of the store.'Punto',on the main street,larger,fresh seafod. In the rear.In between,the 2 stores,you'll see a 'pedestran only', street,in there,is a 'computer and tel.store',with reasonable rates.In front of 'Punto',is a 'taxi' stand,look for 'taxi sign',going toward 'The Vatican'. Stay in the center of Rome,and a nice hotel,no more than 4 days! Do your 'home work',on what you want to see,they have 'audio guides'at most 'sites'.(I heard, there is a 'Rome on 96 Hrs'.somewhere)We had a 'great Sunday Brunch,at 'Westin Excelsior',$100,US,each,that was the BEST meal!Get 'that' location,stay in THAT AREA!!Not necessarily, at that,'hotel'.Most ATM'S,are 'multi-lingual'.Take out, about $1,000 US,from the 'Roman ATM's',thats' approx.,+ only, 554 Euros!Be very,very careful crossing the street(from the Dehon),walking to to the stores! My advice,make your left,and go DOWN,to the 'crosswalk'! There is a restaurant,a few blocks,down,toward 'The Vatican',w/tables,outside,you'll pass it if you walk,that way.It's expensive,and 'mediocre'.You really DON'T need tickets to see 'The Pope',on Wed.,at 10:30a.m.We had them,but no one checked,but we arrived @ 8:30 a.m.,for a good seat! If you go>>> bring lots of sun protection,hats,long sleeves,cover your neck,legs,etc.!I recommend a white sheet,to cover yourself! YOU WILL COOK,in the 'square'!!! No 'Pope',in Aug.DO NOT go in the summer,unless you like 100 degrees,plus, temps.,and thousand of people on lines! Be prepared, to do 'tours' in the EARLY morning,when things start! And, if you see Salmon,on the menu,it's 'smoked',not listed as such! To me,this 'Residence',was in 'left field'.Caio!

Reviews.Title: “Little Retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CNDAbroad
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Adagio City Aparthotel in Rome. This is a great place away from the hustle and bustle of the city. If you are looking for a little oasis then this is the place for you. It is about a 15-20 min walk from Vatican City. We mainly used the public transportation to get around (which was a little annoying as there seems to be sooo many buses and it was very, very hot on them!). We had trouble finding the place on our first day - we could not find any clear directions (my own fault, should have called the hotel). You can take the metro line A to Valle Aurelia then take bus #31. The directions I found told me that you got off the bus after 3 stops but this was incorrect. I am not going to estimate the number as I never counted but once you see the Esso to the left side get off. Walk up the road the Esso is on (this is Via Leone XIII) and turn right on Via Leone Dehon (the hotel is marked from here). The walk from the bus is a good 5 minutes half of it up hill which was a bit tiresome after a long day of touring. Also pay attention to the times the bus runs! We were told to take #571 to the colosseum (we were going for dinner) but were not told that the bus stops running early evening (like 7:30pm) and were stuck finding a different way back to the hotel. The hotel itself is nice. The poolside garden area is lovely and would have been great for a swim (we were too busy touring). The rooms are well equipped. It seems some of the rooms are undergoing renos (no worries about noise or anything while we were there) and some of the rooms seem to need it. The first room we were shown to looked quite well used with old, stained carpet that didn't appear to be well cleaned (although we were told it was, it was just old) and the dishes in the kitchenette were dirty. We weren't happy and asked for a new room (this was a first - I hate complaining and have never asked for another room before). Although they were "fully booked" they made arrangements and moved us down the hall to another room that we think was in the process of being reno'd. It had new flooring and the kitchenette was spotless. Much better (but to my defense when I had booked the room I had requested a room overlooking the pool on the upper level as I knew from other reviews that these rooms had been redone - was not given that!). We bought food for our own breakfast (the hotel charges 6 euro/person). The bathroom was without hairdryer but you can get one from the front desk (you need to leave a deposit but get it back once you return the dryer). Overall it was a good stay. The staff is overall friendly and helpful. If you are pressed for time you may want to consider staying closer to the centre. If you are looking for a little R and R while staying in Rome then this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Iver1986
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend hotel... Stayed 3 nights in September 2007, and it was booked in last minute. Value of money is good.. I have nothing to complaint about at all.. Its wonderfull to enjoying the pool and get some sun, and in the afternoon walk into lovely Rome (down-town area)... The breakfast was pretty nice. And the location with view over the garden and pool is just a perfect beginning to start a new day in Rome... Rome is a lovely city, there is so much to see... I'm sure I gonna stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Awful Night Manager, communal areas tired”
Reviews.Author: Pippsyo
Reviews.Content: Arrived 3am to check in with night manager. Unfortunately he started arguing with us after misunderstanding what we were saying. Things became unpleasant when he told us to go away. A subsequent apology was too late for a ruined start. In daylight went to passable restaurant. Noticed communal areas tired, dirty carpet, big broken pane of glass on the balcony window, and daytime staff over-taxed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: agn1985
Reviews.Content: Have to say this is a brilliant Hotel to stay at. The Hotel is clean, very quiet and the staff are excellent. Brillaint location within easy walking distance of the Vatican (15 mins) and even the Colloseum (approx forty mins), but if you don't fancy the walk the bus is two minutes away and stops right outside the main plaza. The actual city of Rome is amazing and I will certainly be visiting again and so no reason why it won't be at this hotel. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying at!”
Reviews.Author: AMMGD
Reviews.Content: I don't normally spend so much on a hotel (around £85 a night B&B), but wanted to make sure I stayed in a good class place with a reasonable chance of a good night's sleep in the heat and bustle of Rome in late June. We also checked ut reviews on this site, which were positive. My wife and I weren't disappointed! Great facilities, lovely rooms and decor. The air conditioning works properly, the rooms really are soundproof rather than just claiming to be, and the quiet location means that outside noise isn't a problem anyway. The foyer is great, with some very nice paintings on the walls. Nice gardens and swimming pool too. The breakfast is fine. The staff were friendly and the information about getting into the city centre and Vatican was great. The uphill walk back from the bus stop (5 minutes or so) in the heat was a little irritating, but if you're right on top of things then noise starts to be an issue. Plenty of transport options after the initial bus ride from the nearby piazza which has shops, banks, cashpoints, cafes. We would go there again if re-visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Clickers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this residence for 4 nights in October. The location was excellent and the staff were extremely helpful. It is situated on a quiet residential street away from the hustle and bustle of the City, but the bus stop is only a few hundred metres away with a very frequent service, only 10 minutes from the Vatican. The breakfast is your typical continental breakfast, quite basic. We ate in the restaurant 1 night which was just ok. The rooms have plently of space, with a seperate dining area, and kitchenette - hob, fridge, etc. For location and great service I would highly recommend this for your stay in Rome.
